title: Adam Warren (rugby union)
text:
Adam Warren (born 7 March 1991) is a Wales international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player currently playing for the <a href="Dragons%20%28rugby%20union%29">Dragons</a>. His position is at centre.
Warren came through the youth ranks at <a href="Llangennech%20RFC">Llangennech</a>. After a storming debut season in the First XV he won the 2009-2010 player of the season award and earned himself a move to <a href="Llandovery%20RFC">Llandovery</a> for the 2010-2011 season and he progressed to the <a href="Scarlets">Scarlets</a> regional team. In June 2015 he joined the <a href="Dragons%20%28rugby%20union%29">Dragons</a>.
International.
Warren has represented the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20sevens%20team">Wales national rugby sevens team</a> and <a href="Wales%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national under-20 rugby union team</a>. He made his debut for Wales against the <a href="Barbarian%20F.C.">Barbarians</a> on 2 June 2012 at the <a href="Millennium%20Stadium">Millennium Stadium</a> as a second-half replacement.
In May 2013 he was selected in the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national rugby union team</a> squad for the summer 2013 tour to Japan.
